intro: Descurainia incisa subsp. filipes, commonly known as slender leafed tansy, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its use in traditional herbal practices.
